job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Elk River, MN
pros: Amazing residents and coworkers work here
cons: Short staffed sometimes and don’t get a lot of help

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Elk River, MN
cons: Understaffed and lazy management. Not to mention staffing has no idea what they’re doing 90% of the time

review_title: You need to run on your passion to work here
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Elk River, MN
pros:
~Everyday you will go home knowing you made an impact on many lives.
~Though it is a very strict environment (especially since c0v1d) there are still many opportunities to have a good laugh and feel united with that joy.
~You will be given support to advance in healthcare and pursue what you love.
cons:
~Communication between departments is shaky at best.
~Understaffed, but honestly what places (especially in healthcare) aren't...
~Though you will have several fun and good moments with your coworkers but there is no denying corners are cut here and there at times and people pass their work onto you without always communicating it. Its nothing to get hung up on, but just go into your shift understanding you most likely will be doing a good amount of someone else work as well as yours. That is why it is important to be passionate about being there for the residents regardless of what presents itself, your passion will pull you through.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Elk River, MN
pros: The pay was awesome for a first time job and the hours really worked for my schedule. Lots of opportunities to pick up hours.
cons: They we so short staffed that people literally could not leave and had to work doubles. This caused so many people to have terrible attitudes and it show in their work.

review_title: Take the good with the bad
job_title: Culinary Assistant in Elk River, MN
pros: The company pays well and has decent benefits for the industry.  The corporate standards are respectable and straightforward.
cons: The corporate standards are not well-translated to the ground-level workers.  If the CEO/COO had any idea of the lack of director leadership at the Care Center, they would be appalled.

review_title: Picture they paint is not accurate to day to day
